reviews.text: It's the biggest church in Austria, although the tower is around three meters short to the Vienna cathedral...why? Some would say by the order of the cardinal in Vienna )) The glass windows make the morning sun special. The atmosphere is impressive, reducing the visitor what she or he is, just one of the 20.000 or so of the people capacity
One of the most beautiful cathedrals. Beautiful murals, mosaics and statues. It's court is used for many national and international  festivities.
They should've made it 7 feet taller to become the biggest cathedral, apart from that, everything great.

Neo-baroque cathedral in Linz, apparently built not because there was anything wrong with the "old" cathedral but for political purposes in the 19th century. The best reason to visit is to see the fantastic modern stained glass windows near the rear of the cathedral. The original windows were destroyed in the war and the modern replacements are spectacular!
Breathtakingly beautiful. Try and enter at the end of the cathedral and not the side. I personally thought it better than Vienna Cathedral. Loved Linz as well.
A beautiful place and a amazing view over Linz. But you have to walk a few stairs.
very nice
Ok
Very nice view. You can see Linz and more
Beautiful baroque church and nice view of Linz from the terrace in front of it. Nearby is a terminus of an interesting narrow-gauge tram line.
Main square of Linz. There are many places to have lunch and during the night to drink or have fun. This is where your Linz tour should start.
Christmas is in the air! Good food and drinks! A pleasant time with the family!
The Dreifaltigkeitssaule (Holy Trinity Column) was erected in the main square of Linz between 1717 and 1723, in thanks that Linz avoided, War, Fire and the Plague in the early eighteenth century.
Nice spot to enjoy the area.
Just the center of Linz. Very nice area where the city starts
Awesome place to go and relax for 2 to 3 hrs.. You can take museum tour to explore the famous art gallery. One of the must place to visit in linz.
Morden art museum, not too big , if you come Linz, then you can take a look.
I loved it so much. If you are an artlover and you are in Linz definitely give it a try!

1946: Foundation of the Neue Galerie as a Leihmuseum on the main square (Brückenkopfgebäude West)
Wolfgang Gurlitt provides the city of Linz with his private collection for ten years free of charge. After a first provisional operation, the official opening takes place in 1948.

1953: Acquisition of the "Gurlitt Collection"
The city of Linz purchases from Gurlitt's collection 76 paintings and 33 graphics (Treaty of January 14, 1953) and founds the "New Gallery of the City of Linz, Wolfgang Gurlitt Museum" as an urban museum of modern art ,

1979: Relocation of the New Gallery of the City of Linz, Wolfgang Gurlitt Museum to new premises in Lentia 2000
(opening: September 28, 1979, approx. 1,200m² of exhibition space)

1989: Extension of the Neue Galerie in the Lentia 2000
(on approx. 1.600m² exhibition area)

2003: Opening of the LENTOS Art Museum Linz on the Danube
(opening: May 18, 2003, approx. 2,700m² of exhibition space) 
The LENTOS Art Museum Linz is being built by the City of Linz according to the plans of the architects Weber + Hofer, Zurich. The collections are moved to the new museum.

2015: Purchase of VALIE EXPORT Archive 
The city of Linz acquired the livelihood of VALIE EXPORT, born in Linz. The artist's archive will be included in the collection of LENTOS, which will be the largest expansion since the acquisition of the Gurlitt Collection. In cooperation with the University for Artistic and Industrial Design Linz, work is ongoing on the implementation of a VALIE EXPORT Center in the former tobacco factory, which is due to open in 2017.
Good selection of paintings in the permanent collection
Very special place to work as an artist, ateliers have a view on the Danube. It is amazing that Linz has this place for foreign and local artists.
Very good artist residency and the team.
Ein interessanter Platz den man bei einem Besuch in Passau auf jeden Fall besuchen sollte.

Upper Austria. literature Museum
The Upper Austria furnished in 1993. Literary Museum is housed in the former "apartment" of Adalbert Stifter on the 2nd floor of the house. In five rooms examples of Upper Austria. Literary history from about 800 to the present presented. In 2013, the presentation was completely redesigned.

In all rooms original furniture from the possession of Adalbert Stifter and paintings by him and other artists are included in the design, including valuable loans from Upper Austria. State Museum. New arrivals from the Nordico - Stadtmuseum Linz are the marriage bed of Stifter (with bedside tables), the dying sofa and the two paintings "Lunar landscape", c. 1850, and "Landscape study with group of houses and creek" by Vyšší Brod (Hohenfurth), 1841, by Adalbert Stifter.

Works, realities and photographs by around 30 authors are on show, many exhibits are on view for the first time, such as a "Hermes Baby", Thomas Bernhards' travel typewriter. In addition, there are audiovisual stations; On a digital screen wall, occasionally micro-exhibitions are shown.

The individual rooms show selected examples of the oö in chronological sequence. Literary history and pick up on central topics of literature:

"Love": Middle Ages, z. B. Donauländischer Minnesang (kitchen)
"Fighting": Middle Ages, early modern times to the 18th century, z. B. Nibelungenlied (dining room)
"Walking": 19th century, z. B. Franz Stelzhamer (bedroom)
"Remembering": 20th century, z. B. Marlen Haushofer and Thomas Bernhard (Salon)
"Writing": Adalbert Stifter (study)
Hier gibt's literarische Veranstaltungen wie Lesungen, Buchpräsentationen. Weiters ein Museum mit Führungen, Veranstaltungen, Tagungen. Bibliothek.
シュティフター関連の展示、文献が豊富。
Immer wieder neue Ideen der Topköche im Restaurant. Heute super Stelze gekostet. Soll auf die Karte kommen und auch kalt zur Jause am Abend, wenn's dann wieder zun Sitzen wird im tollem Gastgarten.
Veranstaltungen für größere Gruppen. Bedienung freundlich, Speisen OK.
Haben dort ein Konzert gespielt. War sehr heiß auf der Bühne

Ganz ok, aber auch nicht mehr

Would recommen to anyone that is interested in history of one of the largest steel production companies on the world. 

Guides are very friendly and ready to answer all your questions. Tour of the plant was interesting and surpriseingly big.
It was very informative and very very interesting to see how all of it is being produced.

What a nice use of space! The exhibition really gives insight into how steel is made, and there is even a tour of the whole facility. 

The building is pretty small, but inside it's really well designed, so it feels larger. And they have the coolest elevator I've ever seen!
Very very Interesting
A must see for enyone interested in the modern steel industry of today.
I liked the place. Clean fresh air. Animals live in good conditions. Cool place to spend a leisure time. Recommended.
For children it is a perfect place 🥰

Small, but the selection of animals I find very interesting, plus all of them feel close and not so distant as in very big zoos. Red panda and meerkats are awesome! The most fun is the contact experience with meerkats, a bot expensive for one, but ok for the max amount, that’s allowed at one time. They are very curious and friendly, especially if one has delicious food.
Pretty avg zoo compared to the indian zoo..

amazing place to visit. A lot of animals specially  monkeys and birds. I saw a lot of animals for the first time. You can see the red panda there from a very close distance. 
It doesn't have any animal from the cat family (lions, tigers, etc). 
Relatively small so it takes around 2 hours to see the whole zoo.
I had the chocolate soufflé, it’s divine 👌

COMPLETLY VEGETARIAN RESTAURANT.
If you are looking for vegetarian food drop in here. They serve for limited hours.
Well maintained place 
They use Indian spices very well. So you can have continental food with Indian taste.
so many fancy spices and lovely dishes.
Delicious vegetarian and vegan dishes, located in the beautiful historical City center
Very good food, like it. Reservation required.
Great diverse food. High quality. Waiters not the friendliest. Long waiting time.
Not bad

Lecker essen, ruhig und gemütlich. Die Bedienung ist sehr nett und zuvorkommend. Die Preise lassen alle Gäste das richtige für sich finden. Einen Besuch wert. 😉👍
Lovely athmosphere with very nice staff
The food was good. It is pretty dark there in the evening/ night, but this is not a complaint just for awareness. The feel of the authentic Austrian restaurant was great.
Really good restaurant. They serve original Austrian food.
Food was great, made fresh. Friendly service and comfortable atmosphere!
Nice restaurant where you can find typical Austrian food.
